source_note: State baseline derived from Nevada NDEP, NAC/NRS statutes; local rules may vary.

organics.guidance: No statewide mandate for organics diversion; yard waste composting generally allowed under local programs.
organics.bin: Green or compost cart where service exists.
organics.notes: Local jurisdictions may restrict compostable packaging or require source separation.

paper_cardboard.guidance: Recycle clean paper, cardboard, and cartons; flatten boxes.
paper_cardboard.bin: Blue or mixed recycling bin or drop-off center.
paper_cardboard.notes: Soiled or waxed cardboard often excluded.

glass_containers.guidance: Recycle glass bottles and jars (empty and rinsed).
glass_containers.bin: Mixed recycling bin or glass drop-off bin if available.
glass_containers.notes: Broken glass, ceramics, or non-container glass often not accepted.

metal_containers.guidance: Recycle aluminum, steel, tin cans (emptied and rinsed).
metal_containers.notes: No large scrap metal or hazardous containers in curbside bins.

plastics.guidance: Recycle rigid plastic containers (bottles, jugs, tubs) as accepted locally.
plastics.notes: Plastic film, bags, and foam often not accepted curbside.

beverage_containers_crv.guidance: Nevada does not have a statewide beverage container refund (CRV) program.
beverage_containers_crv.bin: Include with recycling if accepted locally.

household_batteries.guidance: Manage batteries as universal waste under Nevada rules (per NAC 444.8801-444.9071). :contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}
household_batteries.bin: Drop off at approved battery or hazardous waste collection sites.
household_batteries.notes: Do not place batteries in regular trash or recycling bins.
provenance: Nevada Universal Waste Rules (adoption of federal 40 CFR 273) :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}

e_waste.guidance: Electronic waste is defined under NRS 444A and subject to recycling or proper disposal (state encourages but not mandates consumer recycling). :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}
e_waste.bin: Drop off at e-waste collection centers or manufacturer take-back programs.
e_waste.notes: State agencies must wipe data before disposal; local programs vary widely. :contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}

plastic_bags_and_film.guidance: Plastic bags and film are generally **not** accepted in curbside recycling in Nevada.
plastic_bags_and_film.bin: Return to store drop-off bins if available.
plastic_bags_and_film.notes: They contaminate recycling streams and clog equipment.

bulky_items.guidance: Bulky items (furniture, mattresses, appliances) must be scheduled for special pickup or hauled to transfer/drop-off sites.
bulky_items.notes: Fees or appointment may be required depending on jurisdiction.
